page.title: 20Farming Around Featherstone
page.content: There are nine working farms in this area most of them are owner-occupied. Thirty years ago many were dairy farms but now only one of them has a small dairy herd,the others are arable farms They grow cereal crops such as wheat, spring and winter barley.They also grow potatoes,a few peas which are vined and frozen and oil seed rape which has increased its acreage in recent years.Most farms keep pigs and cattle which they buy and fatten for market at Barnsley and Doncaster.All the farms rely heavily on machinery and employ few workers,they are often worked by fathers and their sons.The size of the farms varies from 200-400 acres,some of the farmland being rented from the NCB.The land is farmed intensively.the soil is fertile,and well drained and gently sloping.
